json.name: json
json.description:
The JSON module adds support for serializing JavaScript objects into JSON strings and parsing JavaScript objects from strings in JSON format.

The JSON namespace is added to your YUI instance including static methods Y.JSON.parse(..) and Y.JSON.stringify(..).

The functionality and method signatures follow the ECMAScript 5 specification. In browsers with native JSON support, the native implementation is used.

The json module is a rollup of json-parse and json-stringify.

As their names suggest, json-parse adds support for parsing JSON data (Y.JSON.parse) and json-stringify for serializing JavaScript data into JSON strings (Y.JSON.stringify). You may choose to include either of the submodules individually if you don't need the complementary functionality, or include the rollup for both.

json-parse.name: json-parse
json-parse.description:
Provides Y.JSON.parse method to accept JSON strings and return native
JavaScript objects.

json-stringify.name: json-stringify
json-stringify.description: Provides Y.JSON.stringify method for converting objects to JSON strings.

oop.name: oop
oop.description:
Supplies object inheritance and manipulation utilities.  This adds
additional functionaity to what is provided in yui-base, and the
methods are applied directly to the YUI instance.  This module
is required for most YUI components.

The functionality and method signatures follow the ECMAScript 5 specification. In browsers with native JSON support, the native implementation is used.

The json module is a rollup of json-parse and json-stringify.

As their names suggest, json-parse adds support for parsing JSON data (Y.JSON.parse) and json-stringify for serializing JavaScript data into JSON strings (Y.JSON.stringify). You may choose to include either of the submodules individually if you don't need the complementary functionality, or include the rollup for both.

classitems.description: Alias to native browser implementation of the JSON object if available.
classitems.name: Native

classitems.description:
Replace certain Unicode characters that JavaScript may handle incorrectly
during eval--either by deleting them or treating them as line
endings--with escape sequences.
IMPORTANT NOTE: This regex will be used to modify the input if a match is
found.
classitems.name: _UNICODE_EXCEPTIONS

classitems.description:
First step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to replace all escape
sequences (i.e. "\\", etc) with '@' characters (a non-JSON character).
classitems.name: _ESCAPES

classitems.description:
Second step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to replace all simple
values with ']' characters.
classitems.name: _VALUES

classitems.description:
Third step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to remove all open
square brackets following a colon, comma, or at the beginning of the
string.
classitems.name: _BRACKETS

classitems.description:
Final step in the safety evaluation.  Regex used to test the string left
after all previous replacements for invalid characters.
classitems.name: _UNSAFE

classitems.description:
Replaces specific unicode characters with their appropriate \unnnn
format. Some browsers ignore certain characters during eval.
classitems.name: escapeException

params.name: c
params.description: Unicode character

classitems.description:
Traverses nested objects, applying a reviver function to each (key,value)
from the scope if the key:value's containing object.  The value returned
from the function will replace the original value in the key:value pair.
If the value returned is undefined, the key will be omitted from the
returned object.
classitems.name: _revive

params.name: data
params.description: Any JavaScript data

params.name: reviver
params.description: filter or mutation function

return.description: The results of the filtered data

classitems.description: Parse a JSON string, returning the native JavaScript representation.

params.name: s
params.description: JSON string data

params.name: reviver
params.description:
(optional) function(k,v) passed each key value
         pair of object literals, allowing pruning or altering values

return.description: the native JavaScript representation of the JSON string

classitems.name: parse

classitems.description:
Leverage native JSON parse if the browser has a native implementation.
In general, this is a good idea.  See the Known Issues section in the
JSON user guide for caveats.  The default value is true for browsers with
native JSON support.
classitems.name: useNativeParse

classitems.description:
Leverage native JSON stringify if the browser has a native
implementation.  In general, this is a good idea.  See the Known Issues
section in the JSON user guide for caveats.  The default value is true
for browsers with native JSON support.
classitems.name: useNativeStringify

classitems.description:
Serializes a Date instance as a UTC date string.  Used internally by
stringify.  Override this method if you need Dates serialized in a
different format.
classitems.name: dateToString

params.name: d
params.description: The Date to serialize

return.description: stringified Date in UTC format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:SSZ

classitems.description:
Converts an arbitrary value to a JSON string representation.

Objects with cyclical references will trigger an exception.

If a whitelist is provided, only matching object keys will be included. Alternately, a replacer function may be passed as the second parameter. This function is executed on every value in the input, and its return value will be used in place of the original value. This is useful to serialize specialized objects or class instances.

If a positive integer or non-empty string is passed as the third parameter, the output will be formatted with carriage returns and indentation for readability. If a String is passed (such as "\t") it will be used once for each indentation level. If a number is passed, that number of spaces will be used.
classitems.name: stringify

params.name: o
params.description: any arbitrary value to convert to JSON string

params.name: w
params.description:
(optional) whitelist of acceptable object
                 keys to include, or a replacer function to modify the
                 raw value before serialization

params.name: ind
params.description:
(optional) indentation character or depth of
                 spaces to format the output.

return.description: JSON string representation of the input

classitems.description:
Number of occurrences of a special character within a single call to stringify that should trigger promotion of that character to a dedicated preprocess step for future calls. This is only used in environments that don't support native JSON, or when useNativeStringify is set to false.

So, if set to 50 and an object is passed to stringify that includes strings containing the special character \x07 more than 50 times, subsequent calls to stringify will process object strings through a faster serialization path for \x07 before using the generic, slower, replacement process for all special characters.

To prime the preprocessor cache, set this value to 1, then call Y.JSON.stringify("(all special characters to cache)");, then return this setting to a more conservative value.

Special characters \ " \b \t \n \f \r are already cached.
classitems.name: charCacheThreshold

classitems.description:
Applies prototype properties from the supplier to the receiver.
The receiver can be a constructor or an instance.
classitems.name: augment

params.name: r
params.description: the object to receive the augmentation.

params.name: s
params.description: the object that supplies the properties to augment.

params.name: ov
params.description:
if true, properties already on the receiver
will be overwritten if found on the supplier.

params.name: wl
params.description:
a whitelist.  If supplied, only properties in
this list will be applied to the receiver.

params.name: args
params.description:
arg or arguments to apply to the supplier
constructor when initializing.

todo: understanding what an instance is augmented with
best practices for overriding sequestered methods.

classitems.description:
Applies object properties from the supplier to the receiver.  If
the target has the property, and the property is an object, the target
object will be augmented with the supplier's value.  If the property
is an array, the suppliers value will be appended to the target.
classitems.name: aggregate

params.name: r
params.description: the object to receive the augmentation.

params.name: s
params.description: the object that supplies the properties to augment.

params.name: ov
params.description:
if true, properties already on the receiver
will be overwritten if found on the supplier.

params.name: wl
params.description:
a whitelist.  If supplied, only properties in
this list will be applied to the receiver.

classitems.description:
Utility to set up the prototype, constructor and superclass properties to
support an inheritance strategy that can chain constructors and methods.
Static members will not be inherited.
classitems.name: extend

params.name: r
params.description: the object to modify.

params.name: s
params.description: the object to inherit.

params.name: px
params.description: prototype properties to add/override.

params.name: sx
params.description: static properties to add/override.

classitems.description:
Executes the supplied function for each item in
a collection.  Supports arrays, objects, and
Y.NodeLists
classitems.name: each

params.name: o
params.description: the object to iterate.

params.name: f
params.description:
the function to execute.  This function
receives the value, key, and object as parameters.

params.name: c
params.description: the execution context for the function.

params.name: proto
params.description:
if true, prototype properties are
iterated on objects.

classitems.description:
Executes the supplied function for each item in
a collection.  The operation stops if the function
returns true. Supports arrays, objects, and
Y.NodeLists.
classitems.name: some

params.name: o
params.description: the object to iterate.

params.name: f
params.description:
the function to execute.  This function
receives the value, key, and object as parameters.

params.name: c
params.description: the execution context for the function.

params.name: proto
params.description:
if true, prototype properties are
iterated on objects.

return.description:
true if the function ever returns true,
false otherwise.

classitems.description:
Deep obj/array copy.  Function clones are actually
wrappers around the original function.
Array-like objects are treated as arrays.
Primitives are returned untouched.  Optionally, a
function can be provided to handle other data types,
filter keys, validate values, etc.
classitems.name: clone

params.name: o
params.description: what to clone.

params.name: safe
params.description:
if true, objects will not have prototype
items from the source.  If false, they will.  In this case, the
original is initially protected, but the clone is not completely
immune from changes to the source object prototype.  Also, cloned
prototype items that are deleted from the clone will result
in the value of the source prototype being exposed.  If operating
on a non-safe clone, items should be nulled out rather than deleted.

params.name: f
params.description:
optional function to apply to each item in a
collection; it will be executed prior to applying the value to
the new object.  Return false to prevent the copy.

params.name: c
params.description: optional execution context for f.

params.name: owner
params.description:
Owner object passed when clone is iterating
an object.  Used to set up context for cloned functions.

params.name: cloned
params.description:
hash of previously cloned objects to avoid
multiple clones.

classitems.description:
Returns a function that will execute the supplied function in the
supplied object's context, optionally adding any additional
supplied parameters to the beginning of the arguments collection the
supplied to the function.
classitems.name: bind

params.name: f
params.description:
the function to bind, or a function name
to execute on the context object.

params.name: c
params.description: the execution context.

params.name: args
params.description:
0..n arguments to include before the arguments the
function is executed with.

classitems.description:
Returns a function that will execute the supplied function in the
supplied object's context, optionally adding any additional
supplied parameters to the end of the arguments the function
is executed with.
classitems.name: rbind

params.name: f
params.description:
the function to bind, or a function name
to execute on the context object.

params.name: c
params.description: the execution context.

params.name: args
params.description:
0..n arguments to append to the end of
arguments collection supplied to the function.
